text: Would the inclusion of newer julia libraries in <http://autodiff.org|autodiff.org> be relevant in some way? It seems outdated in general but it also is the central reference for autodiff frameworks.

elements.text: Would the inclusion of newer julia libraries in
be relevant in some way? It seems outdated in general but it also is the central reference for autodiff frameworks.

text:
yes, we need to do that.
It would be really good to update that based on
<https://discourse.julialang.org/t/state-of-automatic-differentiation-in-julia/43083/3>
basically scrapping 70% of what is currently there

text:
If someone were to make a PR to that effect, many people would be pleased.
(ping me for review if noone else does)

text: It’s a while since I saw a website saying “site is still under construction”! It does have conferences from last year, but <http://www.autodiff.org/?module=Tools&language=python> doesn’t list any python packages I’ve heard of
